slides.description: The Eiffel Tower was originally built as a temporary structure for the 1889 Exposition Universelle (World's Fair) and faced criticism from some notable artists of the time.

slides.alt: A park on a foggy morning
slides.description: Running in the morning fog not only provides a mystical atmosphere but also offers cooler temperatures, which can enhance a runner's performance and enjoyment.

slides.alt: St Paul's cathedral from the millenium bridge
slides.description: St. Paul's Cathedral is home to a famous whispering gallery where a whisper against the walls can be heard on the opposite side, about 100 feet away.

slides.alt: A tea pot with a cup
slides.description: The tradition of afternoon tea is said to have originated in the 1840s when Anna, the Duchess of Bedford, requested a light refreshment to stave off hunger between lunch and dinner.
The Empire State Building, one of the prominent features in the New York City skyline, has its own zip code: 10118.
